page.title: 17Ancient Monuments
page.content: Two monuments in the area are bridges which span the River Tamar between Devon and Cornwall. The first is at {Horsebridge}which was built by the {Abbot of Tavistock.}This bridge was originally known as the{"Hautes" } bridge because its arches were much higher than its sister bridge at Greystones on the Tavistock to Launceston Road. It has an{unusual {feature}in that it has a number of {stone brackets twenty feet above the {water from which nets used to be hung {to catch the salmon.}The abbot was granted an indulgence presumably to collect dues in 1437.The second bridge worthy of note is the{New Bridge at {Gunnislake which was built by Piers {Edgecombe}in the late{1400's/early {1500's.}This is part of the A390 Tavistock to Callington Road.
